nitf
Class TRE

java.lang.Object
  nitf.NITFObject
      nitf.DestructibleObject
          nitf.TRE

public final class TRE
extends DestructibleObject

A representation of the NITF Tagged Record Extensions (TRE)

static class TRE.TREField
          Contains an association between a TRE Field and Description

          Specifies that the length of the TRE should be computed by the library, and not specified by the user at construction time

Field Detail

DEFAULT_LENGTH

public static final int DEFAULT_LENGTH
Specifies that the length of the TRE should be computed by the library, and not specified by the user at construction time

           int size)
    throws NITFException
Creates a new TRE of the given type, with the given length

Parameters:
tag - the type of TRE to create

Throws:
NITFException - if tag is an unkown type

TRE

public TRE(java.lang.String tag,
           int size,
           TREDescription[] description)
    throws NITFException
Creates a new TRE of the given type, and uses the given TREDescription[] for the description of the TRE. This should only be used if you have created a valid description. Passing in null for the description is the same as calling the TRE(String tag) constructor.

Parameters:
tag - the type of TRE to create
description - TREDescription
Throws:
NITFException
Method Detail

destructMemory

protected void destructMemory()
Description copied from class: DestructibleObject
Actually destructs the underlying memory.

This should only be called by NITFUtils.decrementRefCount()

Specified by:
destructMemory in class DestructibleObject

exists

public boolean exists(java.lang.String tag)
Returns true if the given field tag exists within the TRE The tag is the identifier for the field. Check out the TRE Descriptions for a listing of the field tags for each TRE. Note - Fields that loop will have a tag TAG[i], such that i is the number in the loop, starting with 0

Parameters:
tag - the identifier for the field
Returns:
true if the field exists, false otherwise

getField

public Field getField(java.lang.String tag)
               throws NITFException,
                      java.lang.NoSuchFieldException
Returns the Field associated with the given tag

Parameters:
tag - the identifier for the field
Throws:
NITFException - if an error occurs or no field with with the given tag exists
java.lang.NoSuchFieldException

setField

public boolean setField(java.lang.String tag,
                        byte[] data)
                 throws NITFException
Attempts to set the value of the field referenced by tag to the data given. Throws an NITFException if an error occurs.

Parameters:
tag - the identifier for the field
data - the data to use
Throws:
NITFException - if an error occurs

isSane

public boolean isSane()
Returns true if the TRE is sane, i.e. it contains all of the values that should be there, based on the description of the TRE. If it is not sane, it returns false

Returns:
true if the TRE is sane, false otherwise

print

public void print(java.io.PrintStream stream)
           throws NITFException
Prints the contents of the TRE to the given PrintStream

Parameters:
stream - PrintStream to print to
Throws:
NITFException
